result.execSummary:
The defendant Brooke M Roberts was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations including costs of supervision during the term of probation.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after care. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment or attend school full time or a combination of both equal to full time. Do not associate with users of illegal substances. Defendant must submit a DNA specimen, as required by law within 60 days, and pay for the testing. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

superMiscConds.notes: No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after care. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.  Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Per RASO - defendant has been transferred to the prison system

Defendant Brooke M Roberts in court with attorney Raymond Charles Gamez.  Defendant Brooke M Roberts in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Parties have reviewed ROAW. No additions or corrections noted by parties. DOC recommends 12 mos RCJ. The State rejects that. The State asks for 3 yrs WPS bifurcated as 18 mos IC, 18 mos ES

BTC: Total sentence is 3 yrs WPS bifurcated as 18 mo IC, 18 mos ES/CFTS

Conditions:
obey all rules and regs
DNA sample if not already provided
no alc/cs except by Rx-UA's 
any counseling deemed approp by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after care
FT emp

FAW/vote

Defendant Brooke M Roberts in court with attorney Robert William Keller.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
The State indicates Ch. 950 does not apply in this case. Parties have received PSI. No additions or corrections noted by the State. Defense puts correction on the record. The State recommends probation with conditions to include 30 days RCJ. Defense asks that deft be allowed to motion the Court for expungement. 

BTC: sent w/held - 2 yrs probation. Expungement is denied

FT emp/school = FT

FAW/vote

copy of letter from State Public Defender - not eligible

Charges per attached criminal complaint. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances. This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
